p: Before packaging (t0), the olive oil could be labeled as extra virgin since its physicochemical parameters ( Table 1) showed values below the legal limits for extra virgin olive oil (LL EVOO) according to the EEC/2568/91 Regulation ( EEC, 1991). Moreover, the oil was characterized by a remarkable presence of phenolic compounds leading to a high BI (Bitterness Intensity) ( Gutiérrez Rosales et al., 1992) and a high antioxidant activity ( Sgherri et al., 2016).
